content:
The screenshot you posted shows a combination of two issues going on there.

One is you're using Cards View, which doesn't allow you to choose the information that Thunderbird displays there. You'd have to use Table View if you want to be able to choose the information you want to be displayed in the message list: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/getting-started-thunderbird-main-window-supernova

The other issue is that you appear to not have configured that account properly to make Thunderbird use the right folder for saving sent messages, so Thunderbird is treating that folder as any other folder, not as a special Sent folder. Go to Account Settings > Copies & Folders, select Other for saving sent messages and choose the Sent Mail folder from the list of available options there. That will make Thunderbird change the information it displays in Cards View for that folder.
creator: DavidGG

content: See the answer here: - first, uninstall the software - then check c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming and delete a folder named thunderbird - also, check c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\local and delete a folder named thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content:
I don't know why the server doesn't accept those attachments, but the attachment the server is complaining about is the very message you're trying to forward because you're forwarding the message as an attachment. It doesn't matter whether the forwarded message has attachments of its own or not.

The default forwarding mode can be changed in Settings > Composition. You may choose there to forward messages Inline instead of as attachments. You can also choose how you want to forward a particular message regardless of the default setting by right clicking on the message you want to forward and choosing Forward As.
creator: DavidGG

content: Normally, if the email provider is commonly known (such as Gmail, Outlook, etc), thunderbird may already have the specific information. In those situations, all you need is the email address and password. For lesser known, or custom, accounts, you need to have server setup information for incoming server and outgoing server. We can probably help you better if you share the information that you have. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
Meinst du damit, dass du das der Email-Adresse zugehörige Konto gelöscht hast? In diesem Fall kannst du natürlich das Konto in Thunderbird neu einrichten. Falls es sich um ein IMAP Konto handelt, werden die Ordner und Nachrichten automatisch wieder angezeigt.

Falls es ein POP-Konto war, das du gelöscht hast, gibt es keine automatische Anzeige der alten Nachrichten. Was dann zu tun ist verrate ich aber nur, wenn du antwortest. Ich habe nämlich festgestellt, dass über 80% der Hilfesuchenden in diesem Forum niemals antworten!!
creator: Mapenzi

content:
If automatic account configuration doesn't work, you have to choose Configure manually. You'll need to know what your account settings should be and manually configure the account according to those settings.

In principle, Spectrum publishes the settings needed to configure the mail client here: https://www.spectrum.net/support/internet/spectrum-email-server-settings

The quality of both their "tech support" and of the info provided there leaves a lot to be desired, though. In particular, the incoming and the outgoing servers seem to require different security settings (SSL/TLS for the incoming server, STARTTLS for the outgoing server), something that's not stated anywhere in that page and that their own "tech support" doesn't seem to know either, but you may see in this other page, which may or may not use the right server names for your email address, but the rest of settings shown there probably do apply to you:

https://www.postbox-inc.com/setup/email-settings/access-rr-com-via-imap-smtp
creator: DavidGG

content:
Not sure what you mean. The message is automatically moved to Trash if you read it, but is left in Inbox if you don't?

what is the difference between the trash folder and the deleted folder in the Thunderbird app?

Trash is the folder Thunderbird would try to use by default and may create if not present. The other folder may be the default folder created for the same purpose by the mail server. You may tell Thunderbird to use one or the other in Account Settings > Server Settings > When I delete a message.
creator: DavidGG
